DOC.HEADLINE: US states execute two convicted killers

TEXT.P: The US states of Texas and Mississippi on Wednesday each executed a convicted murderer.

In Texas, Rogelio Cannady, 37, was put to death by lethal injection. He was convicted of murdering his cellmate in 1993 and had been serving two life sentences, for two other murders three years earlier, as well as a 20-year jail term.
Mississippi, meanwhile, executed Paul Everette Woodward, 62. He had been convicted of raping and then murdering a young woman, Rhonda Crane, in 1986.
It was Mississippi's 11th execution since it resumed capital punishment in 1983.
Their deaths brought to 20 people executed in the United States this year.
